verse.roman:
eṣā ghoratamā sandhyā
loka-cchambaṭ-karī prabho
upasarpati sarvātman
surāṇāṁ jayam āvaha

synonyms: eṣā—this; ghora-tamā—darkest; sandhyā—evening time; loka—the world; chambaṭ-karī—destroying; prabho—O Lord; upasarpati—is approaching; sarva-ātman—O Soul of all souls; surāṇām—to the demigods; jayam—victory; āvaha—bring.
translation: My Lord, the darkest evening, which covers the world, is fast approaching. Since You are the Soul of all souls, kindly kill him and win victory for the demigods.
